intro: Haynaldia exaltata var. ramosa, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada redshank, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. The species is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-elevation ecosystems.
